result.execSummary:
The defendant Emmett Weathersby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to run consecutive to case 14CF004563, with credit for 59 days time served. STRAIGHT TIME.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, domestic violence, victim witness, and DNA fees during the period of probation.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept. 
Restitution set at ZERO.
Maintain a full time / part time time employment / job training,  and or schooling. Court does not find that scraping as employment.

Cooperate with agent.
Participate in anger management courses and cooperate fully.
Participate in parenting classes and cooperate fully.
ABSOLUTE SOBREITY. AODA assessment and treatment. Random urine screens with no positive results.

No contact with the victim Tia K. without the Court's approval.
Defendant shall have visitation with children through a 3rd party, but must be approved by the agent.

timeConds.notes: Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the condition time pending a Review Hearing in Branch 38 on 9/11/15.

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: FAXED copy of Noitice of Intent received NOT filed - waiting on hard copy to proceed.

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel.  Additional statement made by the victim Tia K.

AS TO COUNT 3:  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 DAYS, STRAIGHT TIME,  in the House of Correction, to run consecutive to case 14CF004563, with credit for 59 days time served.  

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of  2 YEARS with the follow conditions:
*  Cooperate with agent.
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, domestic violence, victim witness, and DNA fees during the period of probation.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept. 
*  Maintain a full time / part time time employment / job training,  and or schooling. Court does not find that scraping as employment.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBREITY.
*  AODA assessment and treatment.
*  Random urine screens with no positive results.
*  Participate in anger management courses and cooperate fully.
*  Participate in parenting classes and cooperate fully.
*  No contact with the victim Tia K. without the Court's approval.
*  Restitution set at ZERO.
*  Defendant shall have visitation with children(s) through a 3rd party, but must be approved by the agent.

Probation Review Hearing will be held on 09/11/2015 at 01:15 pm in Branch 38.  All parties notified as of August 3, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Jeffrey Wagner, Branch 38, in Room 502 of the Courthouse.

CONDITION OF PROBATION:  COURT SENTENCED Defendant to serve 75 Days at the House of Correction (HOC). Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the condition time pending a Review Hearing in Branch 38.

Received and filed with court:
*  Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

Defendant Emmett Weathersby in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Defendant Emmett Weathersby in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  On motion of the State Court ordered Counts 1 and 2 DISMISSED AND READ-IN.

AS TO COUNT 3:    Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

Defendant Emmett Weathersby in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on all charges on behalf of defendant.  The State moves for the consolidation of cases 2014CF4563 and 2015CF358.  Defense is opposed.  Oral arguments heard.  Motion of the State for the consolidation of cases 2014CF4563 and 2015CF358 is granted by the Court.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 6-22-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Tia K., until further order of the Court.   mld
Received and filed.

Defendant Emmett Weathersby in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Defendant Emmett Weathersby in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case 2014CF4563 and 2015CF358 called simultaneously.  Upon the request of the State, Court took judicial notice of the certified documents attached to the criminal complaint for both cases.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Gary Cherone.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss without argument heard and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Discovery, offer letter and discovery demand was turned over to defense counsel from the State.  Statement made by Tia K.  Case adjourned for Arraignment Hearing in Branch 4 on 3-2-2015 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Tia K.

Defendant Emmett Weathersby in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Emmett Weathersby in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 2 and 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
